segments.advisor_message: So, when we talk about, um, your tax residency, it’s basically whether you're considered a resident for tax purposes in your dom-country, you know?
segments.client_message: Oh, um, could you maybe explain what dom-country means? I’m not really sure I get it.

segments.advisor_message: Sure! It’s just the country where you’ve, uh, lived and, like, set up your main home, and if – I mean, if you pay taxes there, then you’d be a tax resident, yeah?
segments.client_message: Okay, got it! And then, what if I, uh, move somewhere else? Does that change stuff?

segments.advisor_message: Yeah, moving could, um, affect your residency status. Like, if you, say, relocate, you might need to, um, look into the tax rules there—it's real important to know!
segments.client_message: Right, right, makes sense. I just want to make sure I stay on top of all that tax stuff, you know?
